name: Dietmar Saupe
content: Prof. Dr. Dietmar Saupe | Overview | People | Workgroup Multimedia Signal Processing Research Interests Current areas of interest include Multimedia Signal Processing, Computer Graphics, Scientific Visualization, Image Processing, and Sport Informatics. Specific recent research projects: Image and Video quality assessment (SFB TRR161, DFG) Sport informatics: Analysis and modeling of parameters in endurance sports (DFG) Some past research interests: Numerical continuation methods Chaos and fractals Fractal image compression Scientific visualization Point-based computer graphics3D surface/texture acquisition Content-based 3D model retrieval Medical image processing: image compression for radiological imagery, digital angiography, clustering methods for functional imaging, automatic motion extraction for MR spectrography, segmentation of 3D ultrasound data Video coding: real-time software only methods, wavelets Efficient transmission of multimedia data over unreliable channels Data assimilation in weather forecast simulations Object recognition in remotely sensed images Short Curriculum Vitae since 2002 Professor of Computer Science, Department of Computer and Information Science, University of Konstanz, Germany 12/2018-3/2019 Visiting Researcher, School of Computer Science, University of Adelaide, South Australia 8/2013 - 9/2013 Visiting Scholar, Department of Exercise and Sport Science, University of Utah, Salt Lake City, Utah, USA 10/2008 - 4/2009 Visiting Fellow, Department of Information Engineering, Australian National  University, College of Engineering and Computer Science, Canberra, ACT, Australia 1998 -
